messages.message:
> For single tenant environments we disable community context
Came across this--I donâ€™t think we have this detail documented. As I create the docs update ticket, @hannah could you confirm if this means that ST users using the API or SDK must always define the `IB-Context` value because they have no community context to default to? Or do they default to organization context?
@Xindi Xu I think has the best info here. I can't recall how we treat the IB-context in this case.

Yes, ST users also need to provide IB-context header in their API calls. and it can only be set to the organization name. This is for future-proofing. If we start to support community context, or multiple orgs in the ST aihub env, their existing API script will continue to work because their IB-context explicitly point to the current org context
